subject: Politics
title: Kleptocracy
description: A micro-lesson that makes Kleptocracy usable.

hook.text: Putin's inner circle hides billions in yachts, mansions, and shell companies. Russia is a textbook kleptocracy.

buildup.text: Kleptocracy means 'rule by thieves.' The government exists primarily to enrich the ruling elite.

discovery.text: Equatorial Guinea's leader owns $100 million in US properties while most citizens live on $2 per day.

twist.text: Kleptocrats need Western banks, real estate, and lawyers to launder their wealth. Rich democracies enable the theft.

climax.text: Sanctions and asset freezes target kleptocrats. But stolen wealth is hidden across dozens of jurisdictions.

punchline.text: Kleptocracies steal at home and hide abroad. The global system helps them do it.
